titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Cyril Q. Henriques Papers, 1947-1971 RL.00534
titlestmt.author: Processed by: Rubenstein Library staff; machine-readable finding aid created by: Elizabeth Shesko

repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the Library's online catalog.
did.abstract: British businessman prominent in Jewish circles; executive of M.H. Greenman Ltd., a London firm specializing in the supply of handles to the furniture trade. Letters, financial papers, printed material and clippings, principally an exchange between Henriques and his friend and business associate in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil, Max H. Greenman Roth. Also includes letters between Henriques and his son Peter and others. Focus is chiefly on the company business, but also contains considerable personal news and emphasis on Jewish affairs. Topics include Brazilian news and politics, Arab refugees, Peron's downfall, discovery of oil in Israel between Gaza and Beersheba in 1955, the death of prominent Jews, meetings with Louis Golding, Neville Laski, James Rothschild and Lord Samuel, among others.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48 hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Copyright Notice
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Cyril Q. Henriques Papers, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Cyril Q. Henriques Papers were received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a purchase in 1986.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Accession(s) described in this finding aid: 12-31-86
Materials may not have been ordered and described beyond their original condition.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Cyril Q. Henriques was a British businessman prominent in Jewish circles and executive of M.H. Greenman Ltd., a London firm specializing in the supply of handles to the furniture trade.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Letters, financial papers, printed material and clippings, principally an exchange between Henriques and his friend and business associate in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil, Max H. Greenman Roth. Also includes letters between Henriques and his son Peter and others. Focus is chiefly on the company business, but also contains considerable personal news and emphasis on Jewish affairs. Topics include Brazilian news and politics, Arab refugees, Peron's downfall, discovery of oil in Israel between Gaza and Beersheba in 1955, the death of prominent Jews, meetings with Louis Golding, Neville Laski, James Rothschild and Lord Samuel, among others.

processinfo.head: Processing Information note
processinfo.p: [Technical Services staff may need to process materials in envelopes before use.]

did.unittitle: Letters, financial papers, printed materials, clippings, 1947-1971
